page.title: 07Wilton Town Council
page.content: Wilton was granted it's now famous {charter}by Henry 1st. circa 1100 and, as a borough, was third in seniority in England and Wales behind London and Winchester. Following local government reorganisation in 1974 the council was reduced to{parish council status.}Now no longer responsible for all local services such as housing, public health, town planning, finance and rating it has jurisdiction only over such things as recreation grounds, street lighting and footpaths. The council sets a small rate which is added to the rate set by{Salisbury {District Council}who are now responsible for the other amenities. The Council meets in the{Council {Chamber in Kingsbury Squ.}on the first Tuesday of each month.The Council consists of{16 councillors,}one being elected{Town Mayor}annually.
